triples.name: Participatory democracy
triples.relevance: The paper studies how participatory technologies influence political attitudes, directly engaging with participatory democracy concepts.

triples.name: Survey methodology
triples.relevance: The paper uses original survey experiments as one of its primary research methodologies.

triples.name: Focus group
triples.relevance: The paper employs focus groups as a qualitative data collection method alongside interviews.

triples.name: Qualitative research
triples.relevance: The paper uses qualitative data from interviews and focus groups to complement quantitative survey findings.

triples.name: Political socialization
triples.relevance: The paper examines how participatory technologies shape political attitudes, relating to how individuals develop political views.

triples.name: E-participation
triples.relevance: The Direct Line is an e-participation platform enabling digital citizen engagement with government, which is the core subject of study.

triples.name: Political legitimacy
triples.relevance: The paper proposes that participatory technologies enhance political legitimacy and support for authorities even without responsive government action.

triples.name: Vladimir Putin
triples.relevance: The paper examines approval of President Putin as a key outcome variable in its empirical study.
